com.androidrecord
Class ActiveRecordBase<T extends ActiveRecordBase>

java.lang.Object
  com.androidrecord.ActiveRecordBase<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the specific class.
public abstract class ActiveRecordBase<T extends ActiveRecordBase>
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for all persistent objects. It provides methods to do CRUD operations on the database.

Constructor Detail

ActiveRecordBase

Method Detail

save

public void save()
Create or update a record in the database.

The method checks if the object has ever been saved in the database by checking if the id field has been set. If the id is null, it issues the corresponding insert query. Otherwise, it issues an update statement with the current object data for the record in the database matching the id specified by the id field.

insert

protected void insert()

update

protected void update()

destroy

public void destroy()
Delete a record in the database.

If the record has been saved in the database the method issues a delete statement for the record in the database matching the id specified by the id field.

find

public T find(long id)
Get an object corresponding to the record in the database that matches the specified id.

Parameters:
id - the id of the record in the database.
Returns:
a new object with its persistent fields set to the values of the database record found

find

public T find(java.lang.String whereClause)
Get an object corresponding to the first record in the database that matches the specified where clause.

Parameters:
whereClause - the where clause to match against.
Returns:
a new object with its persistent fields set to the values of the database record found

where

public java.util.List<T> where(java.lang.String whereClause)
Get all objects in the database that match the specified where clause.

Parameters:
whereClause - the where clause to match against.
Returns:
a list of objects, each of which has its persistent fields set to the values of each of the database records found.

all

public java.util.List<T> all()
Get all objects in the corresponding database table.

Returns:
a list of objects, each of which has a corresponding representation in the database table for its class.

public boolean isTransient()

tableNameFor

public static java.lang.String tableNameFor(java.lang.Class activeRecordClass)
Generate the table name for the class.

By convention, the table name is derived from the name of the class. First, the camel-case class name is converted to underscores, then the corresponding word is pluralized. The table name can be overridden using the Table annotation and specifying a name attribute.

Parameters:
activeRecordClass - the persistent class to generate a table name for.
Returns:
a string corresponding to the table name for the class.
See Also:
StringHelper

Parameters:
activeRecordClass - the persistent class to create the table for.
Returns:
the SQL query to create a table
